instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_CELL: What is CHGR_CELL? CHGR_CELL is a signal going to the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 battery charging chip that sets PPBUS_G3H voltage. Macbook Airs with 2 cells in series  in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 8.15v to 8.55v, Macbooks & Macbook Pros with 3 cells in series in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 12.23 to 12.56v..
definitions.820-32115: What is 820-32115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.38
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>= 3.39
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.42
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>= 3.19-3.29 but jumps around there a lot.
I am of course unsure what to do now.
thanks in advance for any help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message: PPBUS should be 12.6V. Corrosion around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/current sense resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message: I already did ultrasonic, and now I flux and heat <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but still same. Should I replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? sorry for being such a jerk.

threads.message: also, the owner says the machine can be turned on by holding option and power for 12 seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message: Check sense resistor circuits, <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52 and traces.

threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22=16.3    R705/52=8.3     to me it looks like <CHIP>U3301</CHIP> is missing entirely. not sure if it is supposed to be there on this board. also nothing at j2600
kind regards

Hi did you fix it by replacing the resistors? 
as the schematic mention 10/10ohms and 0/2.2ohms for 21/22 and 51/52 sensing resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message: are those resistor = to 10K on 7021? sorry I know I am still an idiot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message:
7051 at 2.4 ohms is ok
7052, you say beeping, I assume 0 ohm, OK

7021 you say beeping, I assume 0 ohm, NOT OK
7022 you say beeping I assume 0 ohm, NOT OK

7021/7022 NOT OK because schematic shows 10 ohms and you get 0 ohm.

To answer your question, 7021/7022 are not 10k ohms, they are 10 ohms! As per schematic.
10k ohms means 10x1000=10000 ohms.
.
You had before 16.3 and now it beeps...

Check again resistor values of course without power.
Check also traces as asked by Duke

threads.message: You need 12.6V on PPBUS! What is voltage on <SIGNAL>CHGR_CELL</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message: Measure between pins 17/18 and 27/28 to ensure the sensing traces are ok. If that is ok then ISL may be bad. PPBUS needs to be 12.6V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no fan spin
threads.message: between 17/18 and 27/28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

unless I am supposed to be in resistance mode again and in that case between 27/28 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> = 20.3
17/18 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>= 3.13
